alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Garland; Northern Montgomery County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 3:46PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Garland and east central Montgomery Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 346 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Lake Ouachita State Park, or 17 miles east of Mount Ida, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs... Hot Springs Village... Mountain Pine... Jessieville... Lake Ouachita State Park... Hot Springs National Park... Avant... Lena Landing Rec Area... Hamilton... Mountain Valley... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central and Eastern Montgomery County; Garland; Northern Montgomery County Higher Elevations
